content.question: Which of the following does not require the use of the chain rule to find <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the inverse sine of, open parenthesis, 3 times x squared, minus 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3 times x to the sixth power, minus 4 times y squared, equals, 2 x times y to the fifth power, plus 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 3 times x squared, minus the square root of x, end root, plus the fraction 2 over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the cosine of, open parenthesis, x plus y, close parenthesis, plus 2 raised to the y power, minus x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, 3 times x squared, minus the square root of x, end root, plus the fraction 2 over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
